notes: Reproduced on SkiaSharp 2.88.3, 3.119.2, and main (source). SKMatrix.MapRect with an identity matrix normalizes a non-standard rect (Left>Right, Top>Bottom) — output has Left/Right and Top/Bottom swapped. This is upstream Skia behavior: SkMatrix::mapRect calls sort_as_rect() which enforces left<=right, top<=bottom. Cross-platform verification skipped: pure API/logic bug with no platform signals.

reproductionSteps.description: Create console project and add SkiaSharp 2.88.3
reproductionSteps.command: dotnet new console -n Repro --framework net8.0 && cd Repro && dotnet add package SkiaSharp --version 2.88.3

filesCreated.description: Console project targeting net8.0 with SkiaSharp 2.88.3
Reproduction code from issue #2997 — tests SKMatrix.MapRect with a non-standard rect

reproductionSteps.description: Build the repro project with SkiaSharp 2.88.3
Run repro with SkiaSharp 2.88.3 — test SKMatrix.MapRect with non-standard rect (Left>Right, Top>Bottom)
reproductionSteps.output:
SkiaSharp version: 2.88.0.0
Runtime: .NET 8.0.23
OS: Darwin 25.2.0

Input rect:  Left=25, Top=10, Right=15, Bottom=2
Result rect: Left=15, Top=2, Right=25, Bottom=10

Left   matches: False (expected=25, got=15)
Right  matches: False (expected=15, got=25)
Top    matches: False (expected=10, got=2)
Bottom matches: False (expected=2, got=10)

BUG CONFIRMED: MapRect normalized/standardized the rect coordinates
  Left/Right swapped: True
  Top/Bottom swapped: True

reproductionSteps.description: Update to latest stable (3.119.2) and re-run to check if fixed
reproductionSteps.command: dotnet add package SkiaSharp && dotnet run
reproductionSteps.output:

Runtime: .NET 8.0.23
OS: Darwin 25.2.0

Input rect:  Left=25, Top=10, Right=15, Bottom=2
Result rect: Left=15, Top=2, Right=25, Bottom=10

Left   matches: False (expected=25, got=15)
Right  matches: False (expected=15, got=25)
Top    matches: False (expected=10, got=2)
Bottom matches: False (expected=2, got=10)

BUG CONFIRMED: MapRect normalized/standardized the rect coordinates
  Left/Right swapped: True
  Top/Bottom swapped: True

versionResults.notes: Identity MapRect normalizes non-standard rect. Left=15 (expected 25), Right=25 (expected 15), Top=2 (expected 10), Bottom=10 (expected 2).
Same normalization behavior on latest stable release.
xUnit test fails: Assert.Equal() Expected: 25, Actual: 15. Bug present on main.

errorMessages.primaryError: SKMatrix.MapRect returns normalized rect: input (Left=25, Top=10, Right=15, Bottom=2) becomes (Left=15, Top=2, Right=25, Bottom=10) — coordinates are sorted so Left<Right and Top<Bottom

triageCorrections.upstream: Classified as type/bug with confidence 0.35, suggesting this is upstream Skia behavior not a SkiaSharp bug
triageCorrections.corrected: Confirmed the behavior reproduces as reported — MapRect normalizes non-standard rects. Whether this is a SkiaSharp bug or upstream Skia behavior is editorial; the factual reproduction confirms the reported symptoms.
